item.title: Iran attack: US troops targeted with ballistic missiles
item.description: The strikes on two bases in Iraq were retaliation for the US killing of General Qasem Soleimani.

item.title: Iran attack: Prime Minister Boris Johnson condemns missile strike
item.description: PM warns against "reckless" attacks and says a general killed by the US had British "blood on his hands".

item.title: Iran plane crash: Ukraine International Airline jet crashes killing 176
item.description: Many on board the Ukraine International Airlines flight were Iranian and Canadian nationals.

item.title: Iran crash: Three British nationals among dead in Ukrainian plane crash
item.description: They were on board the flight from Tehran to Kyiv which crashed in Iran just after take-off.

item.title: Aftermath of Ukrainian passenger plane crash in Iran
item.description: Officials say there were more than 170 people on board the Ukrainian Boeing-737 and that none survived.

item.title: Brexit: Full UK-EU trade deal 'impossible' by deadline - von der Leyen
item.description: The EU Commission president says the sides will have to prioritise areas to agree on by the end of 2020.

item.title: Manchester City Council set to adopt Martyn's Law early
item.description: Venues will be asked to make tougher checks after a campaign by the Arena bomb victim's mum.

item.title: Ugly Betty creator Silvio Horta dies aged 45
item.description: Star actress America Ferrera leads the tributes saying she is "stunned and heartbroken".

item.title: Greggs staff to get Â£300 bonus after 'phenomenal year'
item.description: The bakery chain says its "now iconic" vegan sausage roll helped boost sales.

item.title: 'Real-life Hustler' Samantha Barbash sues over Jennifer Lopez film
item.description: The woman who inspired J-Lo's character in Hustlers sues the movie's makers for $40m.

item.title: Homicides fall for first time in five years across UK despite London rise
item.description: Last year saw killings across the UK fall but London's level rise to its highest since 2008.

item.title: Labour leadership: Sir Keir Starmer secures support to run
item.description: The shadow minister achieves the requisite 23 nominations, as candidates for deputy make their pitches.

item.title: Mass cull for thousands of Australian camels
item.description: Feral camels and horses will be shot dead as they are damaging settlements in search of water.

item.title: Christopher Beeny: Upstairs, Downstairs actor dies at 78
item.description: Christopher Beeny also starred in TV sitcoms Last of the Summer Wine and In Loving Memory.

item.title: What we know about the attacked bases
item.description: Iran fired rockets at two US bases - including one that used to resemble a "US suburban town".

item.title: Crude oil prices rise after attacks
item.description: Iran said the attacks were in retaliation for the death of the country's top commander Qasem Soleimani.

item.title: Reality Check: How strong is Iran's military?
item.description: Iran has struck at air bases housing US forces in Iraq in retaliation for the killing of a top general - what military forces does Iran have?

item.title: Explainer: The US, Iran and Soleimani
item.description: Iran's most powerful general was killed by the US, escalating tensions. Here's what you need to know.

item.title: Reality Check: Soleimani's assassination and the law
item.description: The US says it acted to prevent future Iranian attacks, but what are the legal grounds for this?

item.title: Analysis: Why crowds turned out for Soleimani's funeral
item.description: Iranians flocked to the burial of a top commander killed in a US drone strike. Here's why.

item.title: In pictures: Skiing against a painted sky
item.description: Photographer Corinne Rozotte's pictures showing the increasing popularity of winter sports in China.

item.title: 'Girl boss' advert banned for gender stereotyping
item.description: A ban on adverts featuring "harmful gender stereotypes" came into force last June.

item.title: Food 'made from air' could compete with soya
item.description: Finnish scientists say the food could be grown with near-zero greenhouse gas emissions.

item.title: Dog found in Blackpool church to be returned to owner
item.description: The seven-year-old Staffie was left by his owner, who said she could not afford to care for him.

item.title: CEO Secrets: The boss who likes to hotdesk with his workers
item.description: CEO Secrets meets the boss who likes to hotdesk with his workforce.

item.title: Travelex customer: My money is in limbo
item.description: The criminals behind the hack told the BBC they are demanding $6m (Â£4.6m) from the currency trader.

item.title: Reynhard Sinaga: How will Manchester rapist case change the city?
item.description: How the city's reacting after the jailing of the worst rapist in British legal history, Reynhard Sinaga.

item.title: Venezuela's opposition leader forces way into parliament
item.description: Venezuela's opposition leader breaks through a cordon of troops to enter the National Assembly after being blocked days earlier.

item.title: Chico Mendes: The Brazilian environmental activist killed for trying to save the Amazon
item.description: Brazilian environmental activist Chico Mendes was shot dead by cattle farmers angered by his efforts to save the rainforest.

item.title: Drink spiking: Do men know enough?
item.description: The vast majority of victims are women, but Reynhard Sinaga's case shows that men are at risk too.

item.title: BBC Sound of 2020: Band formed 'on a whim in the pub' are the runners-up
item.description: Mixing wonky hip-hop, psychedelic jazz and woozy pop, Easy Life are being tipped for success.

item.title: Why is my train often late?
item.description: The challenge can be summarised in two simple words: punctuality and overcrowding.

item.title: Australia fires: How the world has responded to the crisis
item.description: The crisis has reverberated globally, with celebrities and ordinary citizens trying to help.

item.title: The man who got rich on data - years before Google
item.description: Often called the "new oil", data is immensely valuable - but only if processed in the right way.

item.title: Does music make exercise more effective?
item.description: Trust Me I'm a Doctor looks at whether moving to a fast beat improves the effects of activity.

item.title: Bafta 2020: Do awards exclude women and black actors?
item.description: The Baftas have been criticised for a lack of diversity in nominations for awards this year

item.title: Cyprus false rape claim trial: The women rallying for British teenager
item.description: Protesters explain why they are backing a British woman found guilty of lying about being raped.

item.title: Five-day Tests are precious, says England cricket boss Giles
item.description: England director of men's cricket Ashley Giles says five-day Tests are "precious" to him and the players.

item.title: Police investigating after fall leaves skater in 'life-threatening condition'
item.description: Police are investigating after a performer was left in a life-threatening condition following a fall during rehearsals for the Winter Youth Olympic Games opening ceremony in Switzerland.

item.title: Women's event in Brisbane 'second-hand' because of men's ATP Cup - Sharapova
item.description: Maria Sharapova says the women's Brisbane International feels like a "second-hand" event because the men's ATP Cup has taken over centre court.

item.title: 'The worst we have played this season' - Man Utd boss Solskjaer on first-leg loss
item.description: Manchester United boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer says his side hit a season low point in the EFL Cup loss to Manchester City.

item.title: Stefanos Tsitsipas told off by mum after hitting dad with racquet
item.description: Stefanos Tsitsipas is told off by his mum after his angry outburst injures his father in an ATP Cup match against Nick Kyrgios.

item.title: A tale of two pass interference calls - Osi Umenyiora & Jason Bell disagree
item.description: Jason Bell and Osi Umenyiora analyse Kyle Ruldoph's touchdown for the Minnesota Vivings and a Jacob Hollister catch for the Seattle Seahawks and discuss the pass interference rules in the NFL.

item.title: âI want to be racing on the biggest stageâ - two-time champion Brownlee targets Olympic comeback
item.description: Alistair Brownlee, against all odds and expectations, is targeting a comeback for one final heist in the triathlon at Tokyo 2020.

item.title: CES 2020: Ivanka Trump unfazed by critics at tech show
item.description: Ms Trump's invitation to CES had been controversial - but her appearance proved not so.

item.title: CES 2020: Juno 'reverse microwave oven' cools drinks in seconds
item.description: The device rapidly chills packaged drinks meaning they do not need to be refrigerated before use.

item.title: CES 2020: Manta5's electric bike rides on water
item.description: After nearly a decade's research, a hydrofoil water bike has gone into mass production.

item.title: CES 2020: Neon's artificial humans 'don't live up to hype'
item.description: There was huge interest in the virtual avatars created by Samsung-backed start-up Neon.

item.title: CES 2020: Concept cars of the future shown off in Vegas
item.description: A wide range of futuristic vehicles, including flying machines, has parked up at the CES tech show.

item.title: Reynhard Sinaga: How the Manchester rapist found his victims
item.description: For several years, until he was caught in 2017, Reynhard Sinaga preyed on young men enjoying a night out.

item.title: Confessions of a slaughterhouse worker
item.description: A former abattoir worker describes her job and the effect it had on her mental health.

item.title: Val d'Isere: The doctor who hid a Jewish girl - and the resort that wants to forget
item.description: A hidden story of wartime bravery in an Alpine resort, which some local people are reluctant to remember.

item.title: Did Britain meddle in a US presidential election?
item.description: When President Bush needed a smoking gun on his rival Bill Clinton, a key US ally dug for dirt.
